This work proposes differentiable perturbed optimizers, a technique that directly informs the design and analysis of the proposed Perturbation Gradient losses.

references.paper_title: Estimate-Then-Optimize versus Integrated-Estimation-Optimization versus Sample Average Approximation: A Stochastic Dominance Perspective
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive comparison of different approaches to decision-making under uncertainty, offering valuable context for evaluating the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Fast Rates for Contextual Linear Optimization
references.reason: This paper establishes theoretical guarantees for contextual linear optimization, which are used to derive the regret bounds of the proposed method and compare it to existing approaches.

references.paper_title: Risk bounds and calibration for a smart predict-then-optimize method
references.reason: This work provides theoretical guarantees for the performance of the SPO+ loss, one of the key benchmarks used in this study, providing a critical comparison point.
